snippet: Cynthia Wachenheim jumped to her death from her eighth-floor Harlem apartment on Wednesday, holding her 10-month-old son, who survived.
abstract: Attorney Cynthia Wachenheim, on child-care leave from Manhattan State Supreme Court system, takes fatal plunge from her 8th-floor Harlem apartment while holding her infant son Keston Bacharach, who survives; Wachenheim leaves behind 13-page suicide note blaming herself for series of falls taken by her son that she believed has led to maladies that would harm him for life.

byline.original: By ANEMONA HARTOCOLLIS and WENDY RUDERMAN
byline.contributor: Randy Leonard and Sheelagh McNeill contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Cynthia Wachenheim jumped to her death from her eighth-floor Harlem apartment on Wednesday, holding her 10-month-old son, who survived.

headline.seo: Boy Survives Mother’s Suicide Jump in Harlem
headline.print_headline: Mother Knew Her Final Act Was Evil One
